description: Dive into "Vienna's Hidden Beach Escapes" ‚Äî a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Vienna's Hidden Beach Escapes

places.generalDescription: Strandbar Herrmann is a lively open-air bar located on the Danube Canal in Vienna, offering a beach-like atmosphere with sand, hammocks, and deck chairs. This popular spot attracts locals and visitors alike who come to relax, enjoy refreshing cocktails, and listen to DJ sessions. The bar is known for its weekend brunches and happy hour from 5pm to 6pm. Despite being far from the sea, it exudes a holiday vibe that draws crowds during the summer months.

sources.snippet: Strandbar Herrmann: This is a popular beach bar located on the Danube Canal. While not a beach for swimming, it does offer a beach-like atmosphere with sand, deck chairs, and refreshing cocktails. It's a great place to relax, people-watch, and enjoy the summer weather.
sources.shortName: 5 Best Beaches Near Vienna

places.name: Strandbar Herrmann

reviews.text:
If you read this then I'm glad to tell you that you must have to visit this place while you in Vienna.
Very good atmosphere,nice view,nice people
Cold beer what else you want next to the Danube canal .
Just go there you won't regret
‚òÆÔ∏èüòéüôèü§ûüëå

Relaxing atmosphere with nice beach set-up and good cocktails.
Can get quite hot when temperatures are high and you aren't lucky enough to get a shady place.
Place offers good cocktails for a fair price, it's spacious (and outdoors) and self-service at the different bars.
Service is quick and friendly, payments by cards are possible.

You can only make reservations for 10+ people so it's "come first" with the best tables / places to sit.

Perfect for a drink with friends, afterwork, or just chilling over the weekend!
Amazing!
You can't make a reservation, so if it's sunny and the weekend, you should come early to get a seat !

places.generalDescription: Strandbad G√§nseh√§ufel is a popular public swimming complex that welcomes visitors from May to September. It features a variety of pools including lap, kids', and wave pools, as well as a beach area, water slides, and even a sauna for those seeking relaxation. While the Baderbus shuttle service from U-Bahn station U1 Kaisermuhlen provides convenient access, it's important to note that its schedule may be affected by current circumstances.

sources.snippet: There‚Äôs a free shuttle service called ‚ÄòB√§derbus‚Äô from the U-Bahn station U1 Kaiserm√ºhlen (the 1st bus leaves at 8:50am on weekdays and 7:50am on the weekend, while the last bus leaves G√§nseh√§ufel at 8:15pm) ‚Äì keep in mind: since Corona turned up, the B√§derbus is not running as reliably and regularly as it used to. We tried to research for concrete details on this, however, there‚Äôs only conflicting info to be found online and from those we spoke to at the city‚Äôs transport crowd. This is the only so-called Strandbad (beach swimming pool) requiring an entry fee that we‚Äôve included in this list, and there‚Äôs a damn good reason for this ‚Äì because this ol‚Äô favourite is as much a Viennese experience as is waltzing while wearing a Mozart wig, eating a Manner schnitte, and drinking a Spritzer ‚Äì at the same time.
sources.shortName: 5 of the best swimming spots you should dive into along the Danube river in Vienna

sources.snippet: Nestled upon a scenic little lake, the sandy shores and calm waters appeal to swimmers both youthful and seasoned, providing rejuvenating recreation. Expansive grassy banks invite relaxation upon comfortable beach chairs beneath warm sunbeams drifting lazily across rippled reflections. Additionally, a refreshing dip provides the perfect preamble to indulging in neighboring ice cream parlors before leisurely lounging commences.
sources.shortName: Explore 6 of the Best Beaches near Vienna 2024 With

sources.snippet: One of the famous beaches near Vienna that accounts for being a typical Austrian bathing beach created by water from the Donau. This is a little lake in the middle of the city which offers serene beaches, wave pools, tennis courts, and projected nude sunbathing zones for people seeking beach vacations in Vienna. This destination manages space for every adventurous traveler to enjoy good weather in the city.
sources.siteName: Explore the World with Adequate Travel - Your One-Stop Destination for Travel Planning-adequatetravel.com
sources.shortName: Top 10 Beaches in Vienna

sources.snippet: Escape the city's hustle and bustle at Strandbad G√§nseh√§ufel, an idyllic and expansive beach set on an island in the Old Danube. This beach offers a unique wilderness experience within the Vienna city limits, surrounded by lush greenery and tranquil waters. It‚Äôs the ideal spot for nature enthusiasts and those looking to unwind in a peaceful environment.
sources.shortName: Discover the Best Beaches in Vienna, Austria ‚Äì A Unique Urban Oasis

sources.snippet: A typical Austrian bathing beach created by water from the Donau, and formed a little lake in the middle of the city. There are Vaste Beaches, wave pools, tennis courts and projected nude sunbathings in case someone wants to tan their whole body. There is enough space for everyone to enjoy good weather
sources.shortName: Vienna's Baths & Beaches

places.name: Strandbad G√§nseh√§ufel

reviews.text: Even though I don't come often, I really like this G√§nseh√§ufel. It is big, there is plenty of space, lots of trees for giving a nice shadow. Inside, you can find bakeries, fresh fruits, ice cream, and more. There are swimming pools, beach volleyball spots, stand-up paddling, and more. The only thing I don't like is that you can not leave and return, even though you have paid for a day ticket.

An iconic institution in Vienna, this incredibly well kept territory is an absolute must on a hot day.

We had a wonderful relaxed fun day at the beach. It was a Friday and a day off, but even so, it did not feel crowded or packed. Beautiful area and great swimming spot.

Highly recommended

Nice, lot of space under natural shadow to put your blanket or sweater. However on weekends or public holidays it's too crowded. Not enough pool space. So all around the pools is ok, but there's lack of pool space on non-working days.

places.generalDescription: Strandbad Alte Donau is a vibrant park in Vienna, offering a beach and lake for swimming and recreation. It is the oldest outdoor bathing beach in the city, featuring manicured lawns along the shore of a side channel of the Danube. Visitors can relax under shaded trees, on green grass lawns, and wading sand regions while enjoying the clean water. The park also includes tennis courts for active diversions and sprawling spaces to relax amid natural surroundings.

sources.snippet: If you consider Vienna might provide artificial pools instead of beaches then you must visit this oldest outdoor bathing beach in Vienna which celebrates wide expanses of manicured lawns along the shore of a side channel of the Danube lake in the city. Under luscious shaded trees, stretched lawns of fresh green grass, and wading sand regions, you can enjoy the sun and the clean, fresh water of the river to gain a rejuvenating beach vacation in the city. So don‚Äôt miss out on a refreshing beach ride in Vienna.
sources.siteName: Explore the World with Adequate Travel - Your One-Stop Destination for Travel Planning-adequatetravel.com
sources.shortName: Top 10 Beaches in Vienna

sources.snippet: Woven seamlessly amid nature‚Äôs harmony, such oases reflect the season‚Äôs balance of bustling sport and seclusion. Beyond the sandy shoreline and refreshing artificial pools, inviting swimming awaits additional provisions carefully integrated into the landscape. Tennis courts invite active diversions while manicured lawns provide sprawling spaces to relax and enjoy the natural surroundings.
sources.shortName: Explore 6 of the Best Beaches near Vienna 2024 With

sources.snippet: These are not an artificial pools but wide expanses of manicured lawns along the shore of a side channel of the Danube, left by the dredging and strainghtening of the river a century ago. Under massive shade trees, stretched out on the grass and wading on the sand, you can enjoy the sun and the clean,fresh water of the river. 22nd District, Arbeiterstrandbadstr.
sources.shortName: Vienna's Baths & Beaches

places.name: Strandbad Alte Donau

reviews.text:
The best place to spend a summer day, the tickets were 7,60 with all included, we really thought it was nothing like described but it's even better, u have 3 pools, each one of different sizes. 2 volleyball camps, 2 football camps, a playground for the kids, tables for tennis, all in 1 side. The other side is the river, where u can also stay and have a swim, all of the places are watched by lifeguards. There's a shop where u can buy all the swimming things and rent some rackets to play tennis (3‚Ç¨ for 1h). The sun loungers are free and u can put them wherever you need, something AMAZING.
The restaurant/bar it's really comfortable and the prices are not that high, the food is good and the vibe is amazing, all the waiters were really nice.
Everything was really perfect, the only thing I would say that wasn't nice was the lifeguard of the pool in the morning, he's rude, no patience for the kids, and speaks (jokes even) with people in the worst way possible,I guess if he's tired he should just quit, it's a kids place.

Fab. After a hot day at Prater Park on the amusements, this is a brilliant way to cool off. Two pools, the Danube, and a nice restaurant/cafe, and just a really relaxed atmosphere (just don't jump or dive in the pool!). Cost about ‚Ç¨28 for four of us - bargain.
Lovely place for a swim, especially in the warm weather! The river is beautiful with views all around and the pools are a good temperature.

places.generalDescription: Nestled along the picturesque banks of the Danube River, the Vienna City Beach Club offers a delightful escape from urban life, even in a landlocked city. This vibrant beach club is perfect for sunbathing and swimming while enjoying an array of recreational activities like sand volleyball. With its chic atmosphere, it attracts a diverse crowd eager to soak up the sun by day and dance to lively DJ sessions by night.

sources.snippet: For those seeking a lively and trendy beach experience, the Vienna City Beach Club is the place to be. Situated along the banks of the Danube, this beach club is a hub of entertainment and social activity. Its chic and modern ambiance attracts a diverse crowd looking to experience Vienna's nightlife from a unique perspective.
sources.shortName: Discover the Best Beaches in Vienna, Austria ‚Äì A Unique Urban Oasis

places.name: Vienna City Beach Club

reviews.text: This place is AMAZING. You can order and sit wherever you want with an amazing view on the Donau (I'd suggest to go at sunset time). The staff is so nice and happy, it feels so good to be there :) good for an happy hour too!

Absolutely loved my time at Vienna City Beach Club!

The location is fantastic with stunning views over the Danube - the perfect backdrop for a relaxing day out.

The staff were incredibly friendly and made us feel very welcome from the moment we arrived. The food was delicious, fresh, and beautifully presented.

Whether you're there to unwind, enjoy a drink, or have a great meal, this place has it all.

Highly recommended!

Great mix of drinks, music, beach. Gives the feels of being on vacation. Celebrated a birthday party there, Max and his team were very accommodating. Simply a nice place to spend a summer day and evening

places.generalDescription: The Gansehaufel is a public bathing beach in Vienna that offers stunning views of the UN and skyline of Vienna. It is perfect for flower children seeking tranquility, or families with free-range kids. The island has been a swimming tradition in Vienna for over 100 years and it is still one of the most popular spots on the city's beaches.

sources.snippet: When searching for must-visit Vienna beaches, G√§nseh√§ufel is a top contender. This popular beach and recreational area is located on an island in the Alte Donau, offering a wide range of activities and facilities for visitors of all ages.
sources.shortName: Discover The Best Vienna Beaches: A Comprehensive Guide

sources.snippet: G√§nseh√§ufel: A popular summer destination located on an island in the Old Danube River. It offers sandy and grassy beaches, several pools, water slides, playgrounds, and sports facilities. There's a small entry fee to access the island.
sources.shortName: 5 Best Beaches Near Vienna

sources.snippet: If you prefer a more monitored and family-friendly environment with lockers, playgrounds and cafeterias ‚Äì the public ‚Äúbeaches‚Äù Angelibad and Gansehaufel (day-ticket for about 6 EUR) are great choices.
sources.shortName: A Local‚Äôs Guide to ‚ÄúBeaches‚Äù in Vienna, Vienna, Austria

places.name: G√§nseh√§ufel

reviews.text: This place is magical. We had such a delightful time visiting here in late June with some friends and we can't wait to go back! Our son really enjoyed swimming in the Alte Donau, the little beach area facing the UN is absolutely fantastic!! We also went to the children's play area near the two pools, one with a water slide, and had a picnic. It was a beautiful, hot day, perfect for swimming! Highly recommend this place!

Nice experience with great access to the Danube. You can have a nice swim there and even jump from a deck. The pools there also provide you with artificial waves. There is even a water-slide for the kids! A lot of green space where you can lay down to relax. About 5$ entry for one person.

Where else can you swim with a view to the UN and the Viennese skyline? The G√§nseh√§ufel is a beautiful, clean bath and there is always plenty of space, even on the hottest days. It's actually more like a lake, really. Highly recommended!

places.generalDescription: Alte Donau, also known as Old Danube, is a picturesque waterfront city park in Vienna. It offers a variety of water sports and recreational activities such as swimming, boating, stand-up paddleboarding, and even ice skating during winter. The area is surrounded by lush lawns and trees, making it a popular spot for locals seeking relief from the summer heat. With its tranquil waters and beautiful scenery, Alte Donau provides the perfect setting for a relaxing day by the water.

sources.snippet: The Alte Donau (‚ÄúOld Danube‚Äù) is a natural remnant of what the Danube used to be before humans have rectified the river into it‚Äôs current shape. Today it‚Äôs Vienna‚Äôs first address for water sports of all kinds: You can surf, sail, row a boat, swim and at some winters ‚Äì when it gets cold enough ‚Äì even go ice skating. Surrounded by lawns and trees, this is a giant natural playground and probably the city‚Äôs most popular spot on a hot summer day.
sources.shortName: The best places to swim in Vienna in summer
A Local‚Äôs Guide to ‚ÄúBeaches‚Äù in Vienna, Vienna, Austria

sources.snippet: The former branch of the danube river is a beloved bathing spot for viennese people as it's technically not a river anymore. The Alte Donau which translates to Old Danube resembles a lake-like bathing spot with a beautiful view on our city's skyscrapers. Electric boats, stand-up paddle boards as well as little floating islands can be rented.
sources.shortName: Where to go swimming

sources.snippet: Another popular bathing spot is the waters of the Alte Donau, offering 1.6 kilometres of beaches. The artificially built canal is home to rich fresh-water flora, the so-called macrophytes. The area offers 11 larger jetties, equipped with loungers and chairs, as well as a pebble beach, sunbathing areas, green spaces and trees.
sources.shortName: Vienna - great beaches, 500 km away from the sea

sources.snippet: For those seeking a more tranquil beach experience, Alte Donau is the perfect destination. This hidden gem offers calm waters and beautiful scenery, making it a favorite among locals looking for a relaxing day by the water.
sources.shortName: Discover The Best Vienna Beaches: A Comprehensive Guide

sources.snippet: Alte Donau (Old Danube): This former arm of the Danube River is now a popular recreational area with several lidos and beaches along its shores, offering opportunities for swimming, boating, and sunbathing.
sources.shortName: 5 Best Beaches Near Vienna

places.name: Alte Donau

reviews.text: What a wonder this Alte Donau. Timeless beauty in all seasons, soothing my soul. A picturesque haven where tranquility embraces every ripple, echoing the heart of Vienna. Whether to stroll on its banks or swim (when the temperature permits) it is always a fabulous experience !

5 stars, superb quality. So much fun. I saw a fish that was bordering on 70cm long so we might need to work on that in future x
James

It's quiet big lake with clear water perfect for swimming (I would suggest only in summer). They have plenty of wooden platforms where you can have take rest or get tanned. Public toilets are also available free of charge in every few meters. So, be sure to check it out if you are Vienna for Summer:)

places.generalDescription: Schafbergbad is a popular outdoor pool located in a picturesque neighborhood on the Schafberg hill, offering stunning city views without being overcrowded. It attracts a younger crowd and families, providing an extensive range of sports activities such as aqua aerobics, beach volleyball, mini golf, and table tennis. The facility features four pools of varying depths to cater to both thrill-seekers and those seeking more relaxed experiences.

sources.snippet: This is one of the most popular beaches in Vienna that is well-known among the top bathing destinations of the city. Besides providing high-spirited entertainment for children, they offer nice pools and manage a lot of people at once in their region. Since there‚Äôs always enough space for strolling and enjoying the beach it accounts for the best family beach in Vienna.
sources.siteName: Explore the World with Adequate Travel - Your One-Stop Destination for Travel Planning-adequatetravel.com
sources.shortName: Top 10 Beaches in Vienna

sources.snippet: Besides providing entertainment for children, the pool is nice and big and although it holds a lot of people, there is always enough space. And in between, there are little stands selling beverages and shakes, and a restaurant where you can get a very presentable meal. 18th District, Josef-Redl-Gasse 3 Tel: 01-4791593 To get there: Tram 43 to Hernals, then Bus 42B
sources.shortName: Vienna's Baths & Beaches

sources.snippet: The Schafbergbad is an expansive emerald oasis featuring four pools with different depth. It caters to both thrill-seekers and those seeking more leisurely activities. Adrenaline enthusiasts, young and old, can delight in the towering 10-meter diving platform and exhilarating water slide.
sources.shortName: Where to go swimming

places.name: Schafbergbad

reviews.text:
Amazing place. Very cheap, lots of parking room, and very high quality food and service.

The pool is very nice and cool, especially in the hot sun, there is a nice slide to go down, plenty of room to sunbathe and swim, and an option to go swim in the river and/or use a boat to go around in. The tickets are very cheap and there is bars and restaurants around the place.

Try to go early for parking spots and on working days so its not as busy.

Wheelchair accessible, easy to get around and great on a hot day.

I visited on a hot day so parking was limited and the pool was packed, but it was a good experience nonetheless. The ticket I got was a paid ticket, but an additional free ticket was given for a carer. It is inside a large property with lots of green space and lovely spots to sit for a picnic.

The pool was very busy, but the water temperature was nice and refreshing. Lifeguards are on duty and there is a large 3m diving board over a very deep section of the pool. I was able to transfer from my chair onto the raised section (the pool is higher than ground level) and then throw myself into the pool. Getting out I went up the stairs and then slowly made my way back to a spot with my chair. They might have proper equipment for wheelchair access, but I didn't try to find it. I think the lifeguards would offer to help either way (not sure about any potential language barrier). I'm not sure why, but I didn't seem to take any photos of the actual pool. ***insert Homer Simpson ‚ÄúDoh!‚Äù here***

Overall, it was a great way to spend a hot afternoon

I really enjoyed visiting this pool complex. It is very large and offers activities for all age groups. Everything was super clean and well-maintained. The place is very well organized, and there are pools and spaces for everyone to enjoy. A great place to relax and have fun with family or friends!

places.generalDescription: Summer hangout with a dedicated swimming area, floating dock, kids‚Äô play equipment & sport courts.

sources.snippet: If you prefer a more monitored and family-friendly environment with lockers, playgrounds and cafeterias ‚Äì the public ‚Äúbeaches‚Äù Angelibad and Gansehaufel (day-ticket for about 6 EUR) are great choices.
sources.shortName: A Local‚Äôs Guide to ‚ÄúBeaches‚Äù in Vienna, Vienna, Austria

places.name: Strandbad Angelibad

reviews.text: Nice, clean and not to crowded beach, lots of shade. Trees are giving good protection from western winds. For a small entrance fee one gets an addl swimming pool for kids, clean toilets w/o waiting in line, showers‚Ä¶

Love here. It's such a great place for family with small kids! Water is clean, beach/pool are shallow for little ones, also have so many slides for fun. Not that clouded as the other Strandbad around Alte Donau so you can get foods from the beach bar only for 10-20 minutes.

A lovely beach on the Danube river! Big, with plenty of natural shade, equiped with warderobes, toilets and showers. The river is calm in this area so it was perfect for a swim. Public transport is close, easely accesible and very frequent, so no need for a car. Very nice indeed!

places.address: Birnersteig, An der Oberen Alten Donau 1, 1210 Wien, Austria

places.generalDescription: The CopaBeach swimming pool in Vienna is a great place to relax and enjoy the sun during summer. The pool occupies an entire beachfront, and there are plenty of places to buy food and drinks. The atmosphere is very relaxed, making it the perfect spot to spend some time after work or on a weekend break.

sources.snippet: Copa Beach stands as a testament to Vienna's ability to transform urban spaces into relaxing retreats. Located along the banks of the New Danube, Copa Beach is a vibrant and dynamic destination offering a variety of activities. Visitors can enjoy a leisurely day lounging on the sandy shorelines or partaking in one of several water sports available.
sources.shortName: Discover the Best Beaches in Vienna, Austria ‚Äì A Unique Urban Oasis

sources.snippet: One of the best beaches near Vienna which offers many free amenities that allow visitors to enjoy their time there easily. You will find various outdoor facilities lining Copa Beach serving various foods and drinks. Moreover, these vendors provide seating areas complete with tables and chairs for guests to use while they dine.
sources.shortName: Explore 6 of the Best Beaches near Vienna 2024 With

sources.snippet: At Copa Beach, you can enjoy a number of recreational activities, such as beach volleyball, football, and frisbee. You can also relax on the sandy beach and sunbathe while enjoying a refreshing drink at one of the many bars and restaurants around.
sources.shortName: Discover The Best Vienna Beaches: A Comprehensive Guide

sources.snippet: The trendiest spot on the Danube is by far Copa Beach ‚Äì a strip of green banks, sandy beaches, tropical plants and hip restaurants. The Copa Beach has the added benefit of being super close to the city centre, with just a 15-minute U-Bahn ride.
sources.shortName: Vienna - great beaches, 500 km away from the sea

places.name: CopaBeach

reviews.text:
Amazing place in the peak of summer. Way more life than I thought, without it being crowded.

Clean swimming water, great food, decent toilets, awesome atmosphere!
Great place to relax, chill out with friends, or take a walk.

Didn't actually visit the bar or use their facilities, but the riverside area just the other side of the bridge from CopaBeach was lovely. Small decked area for sunbathing, ladders/steps for easily getting in and out of the river, and also a nice seating/lounging area with little tables overlooking it a tiny bit higher up the bank. Beautiful, gently-bustling location on a warm summer evening for families, youths, couples, locals, tourists and friendly swans alike.

places.generalDescription: New Danube is an artificial waterway that runs parallel to the River Danube, separated by an island. It's a popular spot for open water swimming, with Vienna City Beach Club being a particularly favored area. The banks of New Danube offer wide and open areas with reeded sections as it flows into the large Danube floodplain. This calm and family-friendly place is perfect for picnics, cycling, and morning walks.

sources.snippet: You can go open water swimming almost anywhere in the New Danube. But we especially like the area around the Vienna City Beach Club,even if this Danube side arm offers many other possibilities for swimming.
sources.shortName: Open water swimming - The most beautiful places in Vienna

places.name: New Danube

reviews.text:
Such a cool and calm place to spend a day with family.
Please bring along the food and beverage as the place doesn't have much shops nearby.
Very nice place for swimming and picnics
It's dangerous there. Police came yesterday to punish criminals. There are elswhere no lights, really bad.
